content:
TITLE: Cloning and Building Quarkus Startstop Test Project
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the Quarkus startstop test project and build it using different Mandrel versions for comparison.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-1-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-23-0-23-1.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/quarkus-qe/quarkus-startstop
cd quarkus-startstop
git checkout a8bae846881607e376c7c8a96116b6b50ee50b70

mvn clean package -Pnative -Dquarkus.version=3.5.0\
    -Dquarkus.native.builder-image=quay.io/quarkus/ubi-quarkus-mandrel-builder-image:jdk-17
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Analyzing Heap Size Differences by Type (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Merges heap data from both Mandrel versions and calculates the differences in object counts and sizes for each type. This helps identify which types contribute most to the overall heap size increase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2023-11-02-mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase.md#2025-04-21_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
merged_heap_df = pd.merge(heap_df22_3, heap_df23_0, on='name', how='outer').fillna(0)
merged_heap_df['count-diff'] = merged_heap_df['count-23.0'] - merged_heap_df['count-22.3']
merged_heap_df['size-diff'] = merged_heap_df['size-23.0'] - merged_heap_df['size-22.3']
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining YAML Frontmatter for Quarkus 'Get Started' Page
DESCRIPTION: This YAML frontmatter defines the layout, title, subtitle, and permalink for a 'Get Started' page in the Quarkus documentation. It sets up the basic structure and metadata for the page that will guide users in starting with Quarkus.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/get-started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
---
layout: get-started
title: Get Started
subtitle: It's a snap to be up and running with Quarkus.
permalink: /get-started/
---
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Preparing DataFrames for Method Size Comparison
DESCRIPTION: Python code to create and merge DataFrames from the code size information to analyze whether methods are individually larger.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2023-11-02-mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# create dataframes from code_size lists
code_df22_3 = pd.DataFrame(code_size_22_3).rename(columns={'size': 'size-22.3'})
code_df23_0 = pd.DataFrame(code_size_23_0).rename(columns={'size': 'size-23.0'})

# merge dataframes
merged_df = pd.merge(code_df22_3, code_df23_0, on='name', how='outer').fillna(0)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Comparing Unique Types in Image Heap (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Counts and compares the number of unique types present in the image heap for both Mandrel versions. This helps identify if the heap size increase is due to new types being added.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2023-11-02-mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase.md#2025-04-21_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
print("Types in image heap with 22.3:", len(heap_size_22_3))
print("Types in image heap with 23.0:", len(heap_size_23_0))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Querying Top 10 Types with Largest Heap Size Difference in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet uses pandas to sort and display the top 10 types with the biggest difference in occupied heap size between two versions of Mandrel. It shows the type name, count difference, and size difference.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2023-11-02-mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase.md#2025-04-21_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# get top 10 types with the biggest difference in occupied heap size
merged_heap_df.sort_values(by=['size-diff'], ascending=False).head(10)[['name', 'count-diff', 'size-diff']]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calculating Percentage Increase in Method Sizes (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Defines a lambda function to calculate the percentage increase in method sizes between Mandrel 22.3 and 23.0, applying it to a DataFrame. It skips entries with zero size in either version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2023-11-02-mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
percentage_increase = lambda row: (
    ((row['size-23.0'] - row['size-22.3']) / row['size-22.3']) * 100 
    if row['size-22.3'] > 0 and row['size-23.0'] > 0 
    else 0
)
merged_df['size-increase'] = merged_df.apply(percentage_increase, axis=1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring YAML Front Matter for Kubernetes Native Quarkus Page
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet defines the front matter for a Jekyll-based web page about Kubernetes-native Quarkus applications. It sets the layout, title, subtitle, and permalink for the page.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/kubernetes-native.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
---
layout: kubernetes-native
title: Kubernetes Native
subtitle: Quarkus applications are designed to run in containers.
permalink: /kubernetes-native/
---
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Refining Method Size Difference Histogram (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Filters and plots a more focused histogram of method size differences, excluding methods with no size change and limiting the range to -5% to 25%. This provides a clearer view of the distribution of size increases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2023-11-02-mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
zero_filter = lambda row: row['size-increase'] if row['size-increase'] != 0 else None
merged_df['size-increase'] = merged_df.apply(zero_filter, axis=1)
merged_df = merged_df.dropna()
plt.hist(merged_df['size-increase'], bins="auto")
plt.xlim(-5, 25)
plt.xlabel('Percentage difference')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Histogram of percentage difference in code size in the range [-5%, 25%] excluding 0%')
plt.show()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Maven Build for Quarkus AWT Graphics REST Quickstart
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the command to build a native executable for a Quarkus project using AWT graphics and REST, with container-based native compilation enabled.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/podman-for-windows/podman-win-awt-quickstart-build.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
mvnw package -Dnative -Dquarkus.native.container-build=true -Dquarkus.platform.version=3.1.2.Final
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Analyzing Method Size Changes (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Calculates and prints statistics on method size changes, including total methods, methods with unchanged size, increased size, and decreased size. It provides both counts and percentages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2023-11-02-mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
total_compiled_methods = len(merged_df)
print(f"Total number of compiled methods: {total_compiled_methods}")
zero_increase_count = (merged_df['size-increase'] == 0).sum()
zero_increase_percent = (zero_increase_count / total_compiled_methods) * 100
print(f"Number of methods that their compiled size remains the same: {zero_increase_count} ({zero_increase_percent:.2f}%)")
positive_increase_count = (merged_df['size-increase'] > 0).sum()
positive_increase_percent = (positive_increase_count / total_compiled_methods) * 100
print(f"Number of methods that their compiled size increased: {positive_increase_count} ({positive_increase_percent:.2f}%)")
negative_increase_count = (merged_df['size-increase'] < 0).sum()
negative_increase_percent = (negative_increase_count / total_compiled_methods) * 100
print(f"Number of methods that their compiled size decreased: {negative_increase_count} ({negative_increase_percent:.2f}%)")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Maven Build for Quarkus Native Image
DESCRIPTION: Maven command to verify, build a native image, and create a container image for a Quarkus AWT Graphics REST application. It uses Docker and sets specific Quarkus properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/podman-for-windows/podman-win-test-in-linux-container.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
mvnw verify -Ddocker -Dnative -Dquarkus.native.container-build=true -Dquarkus.container-image.build=true -Dquarkus.platform.version=3.1.2.Final
```

TITLE: Finding Objects with Maximum Size in Mandrel 23.1 Heap
DESCRIPTION: Python code to identify objects that have the maximum size in the Mandrel 23.1 heap dump analysis. The code filters a DataFrame (heap_df23_1) to find rows where the size matches the previously determined maximum size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2023-11-08-mandrel-23-1-image-size-increase.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
max_size_23_1_rows = heap_df23_1.loc[heap_df23_1['size-23.1'] == max_size_23_1]
print("Objects with size equal to max_size_23_1 in heap_size_23_1:")
print(max_size_23_1_rows)
```

TITLE: Building and Serving Site Without Guides
DESCRIPTION: Command to build and serve the Quarkus.io website locally without including guides, resulting in faster build times for development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

TITLE: Running Integration Tests with Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: This command runs integration tests by launching a Docker container with the Quarkus application. It sets various environment variables and exposes necessary ports.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/podman-for-windows/podman-win-test-in-linux-container.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
podman run --name quarkus-integration-test-yfTZL -i --rm -p 8081:8081 -p 8444:8444 --net=quarkus-integration-test-sBXIv --env QUARKUS_LOG_CATEGORY__IO_QUARKUS__LEVEL=INFO --env QUARKUS_HTTP_PORT=8081 --env QUARKUS_HTTP_SSL_PORT=8444 --env TEST_URL=http://localhost:8081 --env QUARKUS_PLATFORM_VERSION=3.1.2.Final --env QUARKUS_CONTAINER_IMAGE_BUILD=true --env QUARKUS_NATIVE_CONTAINER_BUILD=true karm/awt-graphics-rest-quickstart:1.0.0-SNAPSHOT
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating CSV for Analysis with jq
DESCRIPTION: Command using jq to extract and format code size metrics from both dashboards into a CSV file for spreadsheet analysis.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2023-11-02-mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
jq -r -s '(["Name", "22.3 size", "23.0 size"], (map(."code-breakdown"."code-size") | flatten | group_by(.name) | map({name: .[0].name, size22: .[0].size, size23: .[1].size})[] | [.name, .size22, .size23])) | @csv' 22.3.dashboard.json 23.0.dashboard.json > analysis.csv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Quarkus Native Image Build with Podman
DESCRIPTION: Executes the Quarkus native image build process using Podman to run the GraalVM native image builder container. It specifies various JVM and GraalVM options for optimizing the build.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/podman-for-windows/podman-win-awt-quickstart-build.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
podman run --env LANG=C --rm -v /c/tmp/quarkus-quickstarts/awt-graphics-rest-quickstart/target/awt-graphics-rest-quickstart-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-native-image-source-jar:/project:z --name build-native-sDjuC quay.io/quarkus/ubi-quarkus-mandrel-builder-image:22.3-java17 -J-Dsun.nio.ch.maxUpdateArraySize=100 -J-Djava.util.logging.manager=org.jboss.logmanager.LogManager -J-Dlogging.initial-configurator.min-level=500 -J-Dvertx.logger-delegate-factory-class-name=io.quarkus.vertx.core.runtime.VertxLogDelegateFactory -J-Dvertx.disableDnsResolver=true -J-Dio.netty.leakDetection.level=DISABLED -J-Dio.netty.allocator.maxOrder=3 -J-Duser.language=en -J-Duser.country=US -J-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 --features=io.quarkus.awt.runtime.graal.DarwinAwtFeature,io.quarkus.runner.Feature,io.quarkus.runtime.graal.DisableLoggingFeature -J--add-exports=java.security.jgss/sun.security.krb5=ALL-UNNAMED -J--add-opens=java.base/java.text=ALL-UNNAMED -J--add-opens=java.base/java.io=ALL-UNNAMED -J--add-opens=java.base/java.lang.invoke=ALL-UNNAMED -J--add-opens=java.base/java.util=ALL-UNNAMED -H:+CollectImageBuildStatistics -H:ImageBuildStatisticsFile=awt-graphics-rest-quickstart-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-runner-timing-stats.json -H:BuildOutputJSONFile=awt-graphics-rest-quickstart-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-runner-build-output-stats.json -H:+AllowFoldMethods -J-Djava.awt.headless=true --no-fallback --link-at-build-time -H:+ReportExceptionStackTraces -H:-AddAllCharsets --enable-url-protocols=http -H:-UseServiceLoaderFeature -H:+StackTrace -J--add-exports=org.graalvm.sdk/org.graalvm.nativeimage.impl=ALL-UNNAMED --exclude-config io\.netty\.netty-codec /META-INF/native-image/io\.netty/netty-codec/generated/handlers/reflect-config\.json --exclude-config io\.netty\.netty-handler /META-INF/native-image/io\.netty/netty-handler/generated/handlers/reflect-config\.json awt-graphics-rest-quickstart-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-runner -jar awt-graphics-rest-quickstart-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-runner.jar
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Dockerfile for Native Quarkus Application
DESCRIPTION: This Dockerfile sets up a minimal UBI 8 image, installs necessary dependencies, copies the native binary, and configures the container to run the Quarkus application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/podman-for-windows/podman-win-test-in-linux-container.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/ubi-minimal:8.7
RUN microdnf install freetype fontconfig \
    && microdnf clean all
WORKDIR /work/
RUN chown 1001 /work \
    && chmod "g+rwX" /work \
    && chown 1001:root /work
COPY --chown=1001:root target/*-runner /work/application
RUN chmod "ugo+x" /work/application
EXPOSE 8080
USER 1001
CMD ["./application", "-Dquarkus.http.host=0.0.0.0"]
```

TITLE: Setting Breakpoint in GDB for CardTable Java Method
DESCRIPTION: This GDB command sets a breakpoint at line 91 of CardTable.java, specifically targeting the setDirty method in com.oracle.svm.core.genscavenge.remset.CardTable. It's used to measure the number of times the write barrier is inlined.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2023-11-02-mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase.md#2025-04-21_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
(gdb) b CardTable.java:91
Breakpoint 1 at 0x407574: CardTable.java:91. (93686 locations)
```

TITLE: Identifying Top Heap Size Differences in Python
DESCRIPTION: This Python code merges heap data from both Mandrel versions, calculates differences, and identifies the top 10 types with the biggest difference in occupied heap size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-22-3-23-0.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
merged_heap_df = pd.merge(heap_df22_3, heap_df23_0, on='name', how='outer').fillna(0)
merged_heap_df['count-diff'] = merged_heap_df['count-23.0'] - merged_heap_df['count-22.3']
merged_heap_df['size-diff'] = merged_heap_df['size-23.0'] - merged_heap_df['size-22.3']
merged_heap_df.sort_values(by=['size-diff'], ascending=False).head(10)[['name', 'count-diff', 'size-diff']]
```

TITLE: Analyzing Object Sizes in Heap
DESCRIPTION: Python code to calculate and compare average, minimum, and maximum object sizes in the heap for Mandrel 23.0 and 23.1.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-1-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-23-0-23-1.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
print("Average object size for Mandrel 23.0: {:.2f}".format(heap_df23_0['size-23.0'].mean()))
print("Average object size for Mandrel 23.1: {:.2f}".format(heap_df23_1['size-23.1'].mean()))

print("Minimum object size for Mandrel 23.0:", heap_df23_0['size-23.0'].min())
print("Minimum object size for Mandrel 23.1:", heap_df23_1['size-23.1'].min())
max_size_23_0 = heap_df23_0['size-23.0'].max()
max_size_23_1 = heap_df23_1['size-23.1'].max()
print("Maximum object size for Mandrel 23.0:", max_size_23_0)
print("Maximum object size for Mandrel 23.1:", max_size_23_1)

max_size_diff = (max_size_23_1 - max_size_23_0) / (1024 * 1024)
print("Max size difference in MB: {:.2f}".format(max_size_diff))
```

TITLE: Dockerfile for Quarkus AWT Graphics REST Application
DESCRIPTION: This Dockerfile defines the build process for a Quarkus application. It starts from a minimal UBI 8 base image, installs necessary dependencies (freetype and fontconfig), sets up the work directory, copies the application binary, and configures the runtime environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/podman-for-windows/podman-win-container-build.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/ubi-minimal:8.7
RUN microdnf install freetype fontconfig     && microdnf clean all
WORKDIR /work/
RUN chown 1001 /work     && chmod "g+rwX" /work     && chown 1001:root /work
COPY --chown=1001:root target/*-runner /work/application
RUN chmod "ugo+x" /work/application
EXPOSE 8080
USER 1001
CMD ["./application", "-Dquarkus.http.host=0.0.0.0"]
```

TITLE: Calculating Percentage Size Increase in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a lambda function to calculate the percentage size increase between Mandrel 22.3 and 23.0, applying it to a DataFrame and creating a new column.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-22-3-23-0.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
percentage_increase = lambda row: (
    ((row['size-23.0'] - row['size-22.3']) / row['size-22.3']) * 100 
    if row['size-22.3'] > 0 and row['size-23.0'] > 0 
    else 0
)
merged_df['size-increase'] = merged_df.apply(percentage_increase, axis=1)
```

TITLE: Filtering and Plotting Refined Histogram in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet filters out methods with no size changes, focuses on a specific range, and creates a refined histogram of size differences.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-22-3-23-0.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
zero_filter = lambda row: row['size-increase'] if row['size-increase'] != 0 else None
merged_df['size-increase'] = merged_df.apply(zero_filter, axis=1)

merged_df = merged_df.dropna()

plt.hist(merged_df['size-increase'], bins="auto")
plt.xlim(-5, 25)
plt.xlabel('Percentage difference')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Histogram of percentage difference in code size in the range [-5%, 25%] excluding 0%')
plt.show()
```

TITLE: Analyzing Method Size Changes in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet counts and calculates percentages for methods with unchanged, increased, and decreased sizes between Mandrel versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-22-3-23-0.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
total_compiled_methods = len(merged_df)
print(f"Total number of compiled methods: {total_compiled_methods}")
zero_increase_count = (merged_df['size-increase'] == 0).sum()
zero_increase_percent = (zero_increase_count / total_compiled_methods) * 100
print(f"Number of methods that their compiled size remains the same: {zero_increase_count} ({zero_increase_percent:.2f}%)")
positive_increase_count = (merged_df['size-increase'] > 0).sum()
positive_increase_percent = (positive_increase_count / total_compiled_methods) * 100
print(f"Number of methods that their compiled size increased: {positive_increase_count} ({positive_increase_percent:.2f}%)")
negative_increase_count = (merged_df['size-increase'] < 0).sum()
negative_increase_percent = (negative_increase_count / total_compiled_methods) * 100
print(f"Number of methods that their compiled size decreased: {negative_increase_count} ({negative_increase_percent:.2f}%)")
```

TITLE: Creating CSV Analysis File
DESCRIPTION: JQ command to create a CSV file for spreadsheet analysis from dashboard JSON files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-22-3-23-0.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
jq -r -s '(["Name", "22.3 size", "23.0 size"], (map(."code-breakdown"."code-size") | flatten | group_by(.name) | map({name: .[0].name, size22: .[0].size, size23: .[1].size})[] | [.name, .size22, .size23])) | @csv' 22.3.dashboard.json 23.0.dashboard.json > analysis.csv
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-1-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-23-0-23-1.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
max_size_23_0_rows = heap_df23_0.loc[heap_df23_0['size-23.0'] == max_size_23_0]
print("Objects with size equal to max_size_23_0 in heap_size_23_0:")
print(max_size_23_0_rows)
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
max_size_23_1_rows = heap_df23_1.loc[heap_df23_1['size-23.1'] == max_size_23_1]
print("Objects with size equal to max_size_23_1 in heap_size_23_1:")
print(max_size_23_1_rows)
```

TITLE: Generating Dashboard with Mandrel 22.3
DESCRIPTION: Maven command to generate analysis dashboard using Mandrel 22.3 with specific build arguments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-22-3-23-0.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
mvn package -Pnative \
  -Dquarkus.version=3.2.6.Final \
  -Dquarkus.native.builder-image=quay.io/quarkus/ubi-quarkus-mandrel-builder-image:22.3-java17 \
  -Dquarkus.native.additional-build-args=-H:+DashboardAll,-H:+DashboardJson,-H:DashboardDump=path/to/22.3.dashboard.json
```

TITLE: Generating Heap Dumps for JMC Analysis with Quarkus Native
DESCRIPTION: Shell command for building a Quarkus native application with the DumpHeapAndExit option enabled. This command compiles the application using Mandrel, runs the generated executable to create a heap dump, and renames the dump file for analysis.

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
mvn package -Pnative \
  -Dquarkus.version=3.5.0 \
  -Dquarkus.native.builder-image=quay.io/quarkus/ubi-quarkus-mandrel-builder-image:jdk-20 \
  -Dquarkus.native.additional-build-args=-R:+DumpHeapAndExit
...
./target/quarkus-runner
Heap dump created at 'quarkus-runner.hprof'.
mv quarkus-runner.hprof quarkus-runner-23-0.hprof
```

TITLE: Comparing Disassembled Method Code in Assembly
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the disassembled code for a method in both Mandrel 22.3 and 23.0, highlighting the difference in NOPs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-22-3-23-0.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: asm
CODE:
```
sub    $0x18,%rsp
cmp    0x8(%r15),%rsp
jbe    0x96ad8f
mov    %rdi,0x8(%rsp)
mov    %esi,%edi
mov    %esi,0x14(%rsp)
call   0xb7e870
nop
call   0x756e10
nop
```

LANGUAGE: asm
CODE:
```
sub    $0x18,%rsp
cmp    0x8(%r15),%rsp
jbe    0x96ad8f
mov    %rdi,0x8(%rsp)
mov    %esi,%edi
mov    %esi,0x14(%rsp)
call   0xb7e870
nop
nop                     // <==== extra nop
call   0x756e10
nop
```

TITLE: Analyzing Image Heap Objects in Python
DESCRIPTION: This Python snippet compares the number of objects and types in the image heap between Mandrel 22.3 and 23.0 versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/blob/main/assets/examples/posts/mandrel-23-0-image-size-increase/quarkus-size-22-3-23-0.ipynb#2025-04-21_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
heap_size_22_3 = df22_3['heap-breakdown']['heap-size']
heap_size_23_0 = df23_0['heap-breakdown']['heap-size']

heap_df22_3 = pd.DataFrame(heap_size_22_3).rename(columns={'size': 'size-22.3', 'count': 'count-22.3'})
heap_df23_0 = pd.DataFrame(heap_size_23_0).rename(columns={'size': 'size-23.0', 'count': 'count-23.0'})

print("Number of objects in image heap with 22.3: ", heap_df22_3['count-22.3'].sum())
print("Number of objects in image heap with 23.0: ", heap_df23_0['count-23.0'].sum())

print("Types in image heap with 22.3:", len(heap_size_22_3))
print("Types in image heap with 23.0:", len(heap_size_23_0))
```
